FuncDef:
The peer valid-ttl-hops command applies the GTSM on a BGP peer or a BGP peer group.
The undo peer valid-ttl-hops command cancels the GTSM configured on a BGP peer or a BGP peer group. The peer valid-ttl-hops command applies the GTSM on a BGP peer or a BGP peer group. The undo peer valid-ttl-hops command cancels the GTSM configured on a BGP peer or a BGP peer group. By default, GTSM is not configured on any BGP peer or peer group.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a BGP peer group.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters and cannot contain spaces. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces.

Specifies the number of TTL hops to be checked.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 255. The default value is 255. If you specify the parameter hops, the valid range of the TTL value in the packet to be checked is [ 255-hops+1, 255 ].

ExtraInfo: To protect a device against the attacks by the forged BGP packets, you can configure GTSM to check whether the TTL value in the IP packet header is within the valid range.
